name: Lemon Ricotta Pancakes with Blueberry Sauce
description: Oh-so-light and fluffy pancakes made with 5-min homemade blueberry sauce. So much better than eating out!

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 200 degrees F and a nonstick griddle to 350 degrees F.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat oven to 200 degrees F and a nonstick griddle to 350 degrees F.

recipeInstructions.text: To make the blueberry sauce, combine lemon juice and cornstarch in a small bowl; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: To make the blueberry sauce, combine lemon juice and cornstarch in a small bowl; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium saucepan, combine blueberries, sugar and 2 tablespoons water. Stir in lemon juice mixture. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until sauce has thickened, about 5 minutes. Keep warm; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium saucepan, combine blueberries, sugar and 2 tablespoons water. Stir in lemon juice mixture. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until sauce has thickened, about 5 minutes. Keep warm; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large glass measuring cup or another bowl, whisk together ricotta, oil, egg, egg whites, lemon juice and zest.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large glass measuring cup or another bowl, whisk together ricotta, oil, egg, egg whites, lemon juice and zest.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour mixture over dry ingredients and stir using a rubber spatula just until moist.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour mixture over dry ingredients and stir using a rubber spatula just until moist.

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly coat a griddle or nonstick skillet with nonstick spray. Scoop 1/3 cup batter for each pancake and cook until bubbles appear on top and the underside is nicely browned, about 2 minutes. Flip and cook the pancakes on the other side, about 1-2 minutes longer; keep warm in oven.
